histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Discovery.AddSinkResult.New
histogram.summary: The result of adding a cast sink to the media router sink list via the AccessCodeCastSinkService when discovering it using an access code. Recorded after the cast sink is added. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Discovery.AddSinkResult.Remembered
histogram.summary: The result of adding a cast sink to the media router sink list via the AccessCodeCastSinkService when the device was remembered due to device policy. Recorded after the cast sink is added. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Discovery.CastModeOnSuccess
histogram.summary: The selected cast mode when a cast session is successfully started (ResultCode::OK) after a user enters an access code. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Discovery.RememberedDevicesCount
histogram.summary: The count of cast devices which have been successfully remembered via the access code cast sink service. Recorded when the browser starts, and any time the network changes. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Ui.AccessCodeInputTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time in milliseconds for the user to input an access code after the UI is enabled for a cast attempt. Recorded when the user presses enter or the submit button after typing an access code. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Ui.AccessCodeNotFoundCount
histogram.summary: The count of ACCESS_CODE_NOT_FOUND errors received while the AccessCodeCastDialog is open, correlating to the number of times a user typed an incorrect access code. Recorded after the dialog is closed. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Ui.CastAttemptLength
histogram.summary: The amount of time in milliseconds that the dialog is loading while attempting to cast to a new device via access code. Recorded after a cast attempt completes, and does not depend on whether the attempt was successful or ended in error. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Ui.DialogCloseReason
histogram.summary: The reason why the Access Code Cast dialog closed. Recorded when the Access Code Cast dialog closes. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Ui.DialogLoadTime
histogram.summary: The length of time for the AccessCodeCast dialog to finish loading after instantiation. Recorded after the UI creates a page handler object. Logged only on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: AccessCodeCast.Ui.DialogOpenLocation
histogram.summary: The location from which the AccessCodeCast dialog is opened. Recorded after the dialog opens. Only logged on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.AnalyzerCreationError
histogram.summary: The analyzer creation error code. Logged each time analyzer creation fails, at most once per processed stability debug file.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.InitStatus
histogram.summary: Status of the initialization to collect stability debug files. Logged once, during the initialization of the stability debug file collection.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.StabilityFileCount
histogram.summary: Number of files found during stability file collection. Logged each time the stability file collection proceeds (at most once per launch).

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.Status
histogram.summary: Status for the collection of a stability debug file. Logged each time a debug file collection attempt is made.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.SystemSessionAnalysisStatus
histogram.summary: Status for the analysis of the system session state. Logged each time a debug file is collected.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Time spent collecting stability debug information. Logged each time a collection is performed.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.WriteDumpStatus
histogram.summary: Status of the minidump writing. Logged each time a writing a minidump is attempted.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.CollectCrash.Event
histogram.summary: Events that occur during crash collection of the debug file. Logged each time an event of interest occurs during crash debug file collection.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.CollectCrash.Status
histogram.summary: Status for the collection of a stability debug file. Logged each time a debug file collection attempt is made from the crash handler.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Record.Event
histogram.summary: Events pertaining to recording to the debug file. Logged each time an event of interest occurs wrt debug file recording.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.AbortTime
histogram.summary:
The length of time it took to run a FLEDGE auction that was aborted. This only happens on frame destruction. Recorded when the frame is destroyed.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.AuctionWithWinnerTime
histogram.summary:
The length of time it took to run a FLEDGE auction that had a winning bid. Recorded on auction complete.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.CompletedWithoutWinnerTime
histogram.summary:
The length of time it took to run a FLEDGE auction that completed successfully without a winner either due to no bidders making a bid, or the seller script rejecting all bidders. Not recoded when there are no bidders, or when an auction fails due to the seller worklet failing to load. Recorded on auction complete.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.First6AuctionsBitsPerPage
histogram.summary:
The outcome of the first 6 auctions reported as bits, tracked per-page, reported at page unload (if at least 1 auction completed). A 1 indicates auction success, 0 indicates auction failure. The most significant bit corresponds to the least recent auction. An extra leading 1 is prepended -- this allows reporting metrics when fewer than 6 auctions occurred during the page's lifetime. Therefore, the max value is 0b1111111 (7 bits, represents 6 successful auctions), and the min value is 0b10 (represents a page that had 1 failed auction), and every value in between is valid. Not updated for auctions skipped due to enforcing the auction limit, see NumAuctionsSkippedDueToAuctionLimit. Also, not updated if runAdAuction() fails before the auction worklets run.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.GroupFreshness.{Type}
histogram.summary:
For every interest group that participates in an auction, the time duration since the last join or update of that interest group.
This metric only measures {Type}.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

variant.name: NoDailyUpdates
variant.summary: interest groups that don't specify a dailyUpdateUrl

variant.name: WithDailyUpdates
variant.summary: interest groups that specify a dailyUpdateUrl

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.NumAuctionsPerPage
histogram.summary:
The number of auctions (runAdAuction() calls) per-page, from page load to unload, reported at unload (if at least 1 auction completed). Not updated for auctions skipped due to enforcing the auction limit, see NumAuctionsSkippedDueToAuctionLimit. Also, not updated if runAdAuction() fails before the auction worklets run.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.NumAuctionsSkippedDueToAuctionLimit
histogram.summary:
The number of auctions (runAdAuction() calls) per-page, from page load to unload, reported at unload (if at least 1 auction completed) that were skipped due to hitting the auction limit.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.NumInterestGroups
histogram.summary:
The number of a user's interest groups taking part in a FLEDGE auction. This is the number of interest groups matching the auction configuration, not the number whose scripts are successfully loaded or that make bids. Recorded after all matching interest groups have been retrieved from storage at the start of an auction.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.NumOwnersWithInterestGroups
histogram.summary:
The number of owner origins with interest groups taking part in a FLEDGE auction. This is not the number of owners listed by the auction's configuration, but rather only the subset of them that have interest groups the user currently belongs to. Recorded after all interest groups participating in an auction have been retrieved from storage at the start of an auction.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.NumSellersWithBidders
histogram.summary:
The number of sellers participating in a FLEDGE auction with a non-zero number of bidders, including both the top-level seller and sellers in component auctions. A bidder is defined as an interest group owned by one of the owners participating in an auction, or, for the top-level auction, a component auction with such interest groups. Double-counts sellers that participate in multiple component auctions. Only recorded if an auction has at least one interest group participating (could be in the top-level auction, or in any component auction).
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.PercentAuctionsSuccessfulPerPage
histogram.summary:
The percentage of auctions (runAdAuction() calls) per-page that succeed, from page load to unload, reported at unload (if at least 1 auction completed), rounded down to the nearest percent. Not updated for auctions skipped due to enforcing the auction limit, see NumAuctionsSkippedDueToAuctionLimit. Also, not updated if runAdAuction() fails before the auction worklets run.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.Result
histogram.summary:
The final result type of running a FLEDGE auction. Recorded on auction completion/cancellation.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.TimeSinceLastAuctionPerPage
histogram.summary:
The duration between runAdAuction() calls, collected on a per-page basis, reported on each auction. Not updated for auctions skipped due to enforcing the auction limit, see NumAuctionsSkippedDueToAuctionLimit. Also, not updated if runAdAuction() fails before the auction worklets run.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Net.DownloadTime.{Type}
histogram.summary:
Time required to download {Type} requests, reported upon receving a response.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Net.RequestUrlSizeBytes.{Type}
histogram.summary:
The number of bytes sent for {Type} requests, reported upon each request. This is just the size of the request URL; it doesn't include the size of the HTTP headers or the word "GET".
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.InterestGroup.Net.ResponseSizeBytes.{Type}
histogram.summary:
The number of bytes received for {Type} requests, reported upon receving a response.
See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md for the latest version of the FLEDGE explainer.

histogram.name: Ads.Media.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of HTML5 media (when known). Only recorded for media within ad subframes. This is recorded every time the duration changes for a video, and can be recorded multiple times for a single video (the overall duration may not be known when loading starts). Because the duration will generally increase as more video gets buffered, this histogram may skew low.

histogram.name: Ads.Media.LoadType
histogram.summary: Load type of HTML5 media in ad subframes such as URL, MediaSource and MediaStream.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Cache2
histogram.summary: For a given resource fetched from the disk cache or blink memory cache, logs the encoded body length of the resource, even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete. Recorded when the resource request is complete, or when the page is destroyed/navigated for incomplete resources. The sum of samples across a page load may differ substatially from the true sum due to per-sample rounding. These are not intended to be compared to page level histograms.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Network
histogram.summary: For a given resource fetched from the network, logs the network bytes used to load the resource (including headers), even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete. Recorded when the resource request is complete, or when the page is destroyed/navigated for incomplete resources. The sum of samples across a page load may differ substatially from the true sum due to per-sample rounding. These are not intended to be compared to page level histograms.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.OnDSE.SameHost
histogram.summary: True if the target link of the anchor element has the same host as the root document. Recorded only on default search engine pages.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.OnNonDSE.SameHost
histogram.summary: True if the target link of the anchor element has the same host as the root document. Recorded only on pages whose URL do not match the default search engine.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.IsSameHost
histogram.summary: True if the target link of the anchor element has the same host as the root document.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Visible.NumberOfAnchorElementsAfterMerge
histogram.summary: The number of anchor element metrics sent to the browser process on a page load. Anchor elements having the same href are merged and counted as 1. This histogram is recorded when the webpage is loaded.

histogram.name: AnimatedImage.NumOfFramesSkipped
histogram.summary:
If the frame rate for the image animation can not be reached, frames in the animation are skipped to catch up to the desired frame. This metric tracks the number of frames skipped during catch up, and can be used to assess the smoothness of these animations. It records the number of frames skipped each time the animation is ticked forward to draw the next frame. In the ideal case, where the animation can be drawn at the desired rate, 0 frames should be skipped. Note that skipping of frames can also be triggered if the animation was intentionally paused (on becoming off-screen, or the tab being hidden).
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-04-24 to 2022-04-29; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Animation.AnimationWorklet.Dispatcher.AsynchronousMutateDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it takes the WorkletMutatorDispatcher to complete an asynchronous mutation request of animation worklet. The measured time is the total elapsed time from when a request is queued until the results are received.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Animation.AnimationWorklet.Dispatcher.SynchronousMutateDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it takes the WorkletMutatorDispatcher to dispatch to and mutate all animation worklet mutators synchronously. This includes the time that it takes each AnimationWorkletGlobalScope to produce its output (which includes V8 script execution) and also any queuing cost associated with posting mutation tasks and receiving responses.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Animation.AnimationWorklet.MutateDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it takes for an AnimationWorklet to produce a mutation update. This includes all V8 script execution cost.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: AppleScript.CommandEvent
histogram.summary: The number of times an AppleScript event gets called.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigChange
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnConfigChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigNotifyInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParsePosix
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServicePosix.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseWin
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostParseResult
histogram.summary: Whether DnsHosts were parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsChange
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnHostsChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsNotifyInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseWin
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsHosts in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerCount
histogram.summary: Count of servers in DnsConfig. Recorded on every new DnsSession, which is created on DNS change.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedConfigInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time since the last empty config result to the time a non-change OnConfigChange is received.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedHostsInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time since the last empty config result to the time a non-change OnHostsChange is received.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.WatchStatus
histogram.summary: The result of DnsConfigService watch. Counts STARTED on every initialization and FAILED_* on any failure.

histogram.name: Aura.CreatedGpuBrowserCompositor
histogram.summary: Whether the browser compositor uses GPU or the software renderer.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.Cleanup
histogram.summary: Logged when the Autocomplete Retention Policy cleaned up expired entries. Expired entries are entries that haven't been used in the last 14 months.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.DaysSinceLastUse
histogram.summary: Logged when users select Autocomplete entries in the dropdown, this histogram captures the number of days that have passed since the selected autocomplete entry was last used. I.e., the distribution of time between uses of an "active" autocomplete entry.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.Events
histogram.summary:
Autocomplete events recorded when the user interacts with suggestions served from Autocomplete.
Note that this histogram was disabled after M85 and was only reenabled on 25.02.2021.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.MatchType
histogram.summary: Type of AutocompleteMatch. Recorded every time the autocomplete action predictor in omnibox triggers a preresolve, or a preconnect.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.AccurateCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M97 as it was expired and it was not not updated on omnibox reverts, which led to incorrect counts. AutocompleteActionPredictor.NoStatePrefetchStatus is the new alternative.
histogram.summary: Every time we calculate the confidence for a URL to determine if it should be prerendered, we track the URL and confidence calculated. When an Omnibox navigation happens, if we calculated a confidence for that URL, a count is incremented for the confidence that was calculated. This histogram is then a histogram of counts that relates the number of correctly predicted URLs to a confidence value. By comparing that number to the AutocompleteActionPredictor.NavigationCount and Prerender.OmniboxNavigationsUsedPrerenderCount histograms, it's possible to determine the effect of changing the confidence threshold on the accuracy of prerendering prediction.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.Action
histogram.summary: The distribution of network actions recommended by the AutocompleteActionPredictor. A network action can be one of the enumerated AutocompleteActionPredictor::Action values: PRERENDER, PRECONNECT, or NONE. The AutocompleteActionPredictor recommends one of these based on a confidence score for a given URL and user-entered text pair.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.Confidence
histogram.summary: The distribution of confidence ratings. The AutocompleteActionPredictor uses a heuristic to calculate a confidence score given a URL and user-entered text pair. It is in the range [0,1] and is mapped on to a recommended action, one of the enumerated AutocompleteActionPredictor::Action values: PRERENDER, PRECONNECT or NONE. This is the distribution of those scores multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.DatabaseAction
histogram.summary: Trackes the number of times something is added, removed, or deleted from the AutocompleteActionPredictor backing database.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.DatabaseRowCount
histogram.summary: The distribution of row counts for the AutocompleteActionPredictorDatabase. Each row contains information regarding the user's Omnibox use history.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.MatchIsInDb
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates if the autocomplete suggestion under consideration by the AutocompleteActionPredictor was found in the database. This gives an upper bound on the fraction of suggestions it is possible to calculate a confidence for, and thus an upper bound on the fraction of suggestions that can be prerendered.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.NavigationCount
histogram.summary: The number of navigations triggered by the Omnibox and seen by the AutocompleteActionPredictor. This triggers when the Omnibox is showing Autocomplete results to the user and they select one with the mouse or by pressing enter.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.NoStatePrefetchStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of no state prefetches started by the omnibox action predictor. In particular, this records whether they were used or not.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.PrerenderStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of prerender started by the omnibox action predictor. In particular, this records whether they were used or not.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.CacheEntryAge.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98. The corresponding histogram for canary checks is PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.CacheEntryAge.
histogram.summary: How old a cached probe result was when it was used, in hours.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.DidSucceed.AfterReportedFailure.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.summary: Records the completion status of a probe retry after an externally reported failure.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.DidSucceed.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.summary: Records the completion status of a probe when it completes each attempt.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.FinalState.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98. The corresponding histogram for canary checks is PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.FinalState.
histogram.summary: Records the end state of a probe just before it goes inactive. This happens when the prober succeeds, fails and has no more retries, or the delegate stops probing.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.GenerateCacheKey.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98. The corresponding histogram for canary checks is PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.GenerateCacheKey.
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent generating a cache key for the availability prober. In particular, this tracks how much getNetworkOperator calls might be slowing down this method. See crbug.com/1266018 for more details.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.NetError.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98. The corresponding histogram for canary checks is PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.NetError.
histogram.summary: Records the net error of a completed or timed out probe. Note that if a HTTP response does not occur within the probe's TTL, when a sample will also be added to the ERR_TIMED_OUT bucket.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.NumAttemptsBeforeSuccess.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98. The corresponding histogram for canary checks is PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.NumAttemptsBeforeSuccess.
histogram.summary: Records the number of attempts that are made to achieve a successful probe result. Only recorded on success. This metric is 1-based so if a probe succeeds the first time, a sample of 1 will be recorded.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.ResponseCode.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.summary: Records the HTTP response code of a completed probe, when a HTTP response is received.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.TimeUntilFailure2.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98. The corresponding histogram for canary checks is PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.TimeUntilFailure.
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent working on a single probe attempt to get to a failed state. Recorded every time a probe fails.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.TimeUntilSuccess2.{AvailabilityProberClient}
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98. The corresponding histogram for canary checks is PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.TimeUntilSuccess.
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent working on a single probe attempt to get to a successful state. Recorded every time a probe succeeds.

histogram.name: Badging.AppBadgeUpdate.Mac.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M88 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The result from updating the app badge on macOS.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.NumberBatteriesLinux
histogram.summary: Number of batteries reported by the UPower service on Linux at the start of the Battery Status API.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.NumberBatteriesMac
histogram.summary: Number of internal batteries reported by MacOS at the start of the Battery Status API.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.NumberBatteriesWin
histogram.summary: Number of batteries reported by Windows at the start of the Battery Status API.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.StartAndroid
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2021-09-02 due to being unused in the codebase.
histogram.summary: Whether the Battery Status API was successfully started up on Android.

histogram.name: Blimp.Compositor.CommitSizeKb
histogram.summary: Records the size of the uncompressed commit messages received by Blimp compositor.

histogram.name: Blimp.Connected
histogram.summary: Records whether connection attempt to the Blimp engine was successful.

histogram.name: Blimp.Supported
histogram.summary: Records whether Blimp is supported.

histogram.name: Blimp.Tab.Visible
histogram.summary: Records whenever a Blimp tab toggles visibility.

histogram.name: BlueZ.AdapterLost
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records a duration of a Bluetooth adapter being lost. This helps us better understand the Bluetooth controller drop issue in the field.

histogram.name: BlueZ.AdvertisementMonitor.NumOfMonitors
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the number of active advertisement monitors every couple of minutes. This helps us to gauge the additional power requirement for the advertisement monitor feature.

histogram.name: BlueZ.AdvertisementMonitor.{Filter}.FilterPatternsPerMinute
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the number of advertisement packet received in the user space while the advertisement monitor is done using {Filter} filtering. This helps us to gauge the additional power requirement for the advertisement monitor feature.

histogram.name: BlueZ.AdvertisementMonitor.{Filter}.{Operation}.Result
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the outcome of {Operation} operation of advertisement monitor when {Filter} filtering is used. This helps us to verify the correctness of this feature as well as to point out possible regression.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ChipLost2
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records a duration of a Bluetooth adapter being lost caused by hardware disconnection. This helps us better understand the Bluetooth controller drop issue in the field.

histogram.name: BlueZ.NumberOfExistingAdvertisements
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the number of existing advertisements when registering for a new advertisement. This helps us better understand the common amount of advertisments used and the registration failures due to the limited number of advertisement slots.

histogram.name: BlueZ.PerProfile.ConnectionResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of bluetooth profile connection request to a remote device. This helps to understand the percentage of successful profile connections against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.PerProfile.ProbingResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of bluetooth profile probing while pairing with a remote device. This helps to understand the percentage of successful profile probing against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ReasonOfDisconnection
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the reason of Bluetooth disconnection between the local device and the remote Bluetooth device. This helps us better understand the initiator of disconnection request.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ResultOfAdvertisementRegistration
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the outcomes of advertisement registration. This helps us better understand the persentage of successful advertisements against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ResultOfConnection
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the outcomes of connection requests to remote devices. This helps us better understand the persentage of successful connections against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ResultOfPairing
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the outcomes of pairing with remote devices. This helps us better understand the persentage of successful pairing against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfAdvertisement
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration when the local device is performing Bluetooth advertisment and discoverable as a Bluetooth Low Energy device by other devices. This helps us better understand the amount of successful advertisment sessions and the duration.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfDiscoverable
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration when the local device is discoverable by other devices as a Bluetooth classic device. This helps us better understand the amount of requests to expose the local device as a Bluetooth classic device and the duration.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfDiscovering
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration for the local device to perform device discovery. This helps us better understand the amount of device discovery request and the duration for users to find the target device.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfPairing
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration taken to finish a successful pairing between the local device and a remote Bluetooth device. This helps us better understand the latency of completing Bluetooth pairing.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfSetupConnection
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration taken to finish a successful connection between the local device and a remote Bluetooth device. This helps us better understand the latency of connecting to a Bluetooth device.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TypeOfDiscovery
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the types of device discovery performed by the local device. This helps us better understand the most common type of device discovery performed.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TypeOfFoundDevice
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the types of discovered devices in terms of Bluetooth classic, Bluetooth low energy and Dual-mode supports. This helps us better understand the persentage of Bluetooth devices in terms of type.

Time from chrome binary exec to login UI ready on Chrome OS. This is recorded from the platform side after receiving "login-ui-visible" event on the platform side in the send-boot-metrics.conf script.

histogram.name: BootTime.Login2

histogram.name: BootTime.System

Time from system code being called to starting Chrome (Chrome OS).

Time spent in microseconds to perform calls to SetFont in Canvas for Canvas2d. It's measured each time SetFont is called.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.ModernLinkerDetailedLoadTime.{LoadKind}
histogram.summary:
The ModernLinker loads the native library twice: once with android_dlopen_ext, and if the first one does not fail, also invokes System.loadLibrary(). This histogram reflects the time to load the native library when {LoadKind}.
Failed load does not record a sample. Failing the first load would also avoid recording the histogram for the second load.
See a description of RELRO sharing here: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/android_native_libraries.md#RELRO-Sharing

variant.name: Consume
variant.summary: consuming an external RELRO is expected later, with android_dlopen_ext

variant.name: NoSharing
variant.summary: RELRO sharing cooperation is not requested (fallback, in testing)

variant.name: Produce
variant.summary: producing RELRO is requested, with android_dlopen_ext

variant.name: Second
variant.summary: the first load succeeded and the System.loadLibrary() time is measured

histogram.summary:
Same as ModernLinkerDetailedLoadTime.*, but additionally split by process background state as known to cgroups.
Reflects load time when the app {BackgroundState}. When {LoadKind}.

variant.name: Consume
variant.summary: consuming an external RELRO is expected later, with android_dlopen_ext

variant.name: NoSharing
variant.summary: RELRO sharing cooperation is not requested (fallback, in testing)

variant.name: Produce
variant.summary: producing RELRO is requested, with android_dlopen_ext

variant.name: Second
variant.summary: the first load succeeded and the System.loadLibrary() time is measured

variant.name: Unknown

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroAvailableImmediately
histogram.summary: Recorded when RELRO is replaced with a shared memory region, in all processes consuming RELRO. Indicates whether the shared RELRO was available synchronously right after the native library was loaded. ModernLinker only.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroProvidedSuccessfully
histogram.summary: Recorded when the native library is loaded by the Chromium linker, and an attempt to spawn a shared RELRO region is made. Indicates whether the attempt was a success. If the number of samples from "ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroAvailableImmediately" where the availability was not immediate is large compared to the counts of successful RELRO spawns, it would indicate potential startup performance improvements when starting child process(es) during early browser startup phases. ModernLinker only.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroSharingStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded when RELRO is replaced with a shared memory region, in all processes consuming RELRO. Indicates whether the replacement was a success. ModernLinker only.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroSharingStatus2
histogram.summary:
Recorded when RELRO is replaced with a shared memory region, in all processes consuming RELRO. Indicates whether the replacement was a success. ModernLinker only.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RendererLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to load the native libraries in the renderer process.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.TimeToFindWebViewReservation.{SearchStatus}.{ProcessType}
histogram.summary:
The amount of time to find the memory address reservation intended for WebView. This search is sometimes initiated as an early stage of loading the native library. A sample is discarded if the attempt to load the native library fails.
Measured when running in {ProcessType} process. Only for {SearchStatus} searches.
For a more detailed description of each suffix process type suffix (Browser, Child, Zygote) see description of the ChromiumAndroidLinker.*LoadTime2.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.{ProcessType}LoadTime2
histogram.summary:
The amount of time it took to load the native libraries in {ProcessType}.
In order to explain the nature of the uploaded samples for this histogram it is necessary to define a few core properties of the running processes.
On Android 10 (=Q) a new feature was introduced and became used in Chrome: App Zygotes. An App Zygote (AZ) is a process pre-created by the system to allow faster initialization of isolated processes (IP) for a specific app. When AZ is created it runs the app-specific "preload" function once, and becomes idle, after that no work can be performed in the AZ other than getting forked. Whenever an app requests the Android Framework (AF) to provide an isolated process, the AF notifies the AZ to fork itself into a new process, which later will be provided to the app. An AZ created for one app (package) cannot be used for another app.
The purpose of the AZ in Chrome is to load the native library - it avoids loading the same library in each isolated process separately.
Capabilities of the AZ are very restricted. It runs in the same sandbox constraints as an isolated process, while also not having the ability to communicate with any other process on the system. Only after forking from the AZ the inherited process becomes able to communicate to the rest of Chrome.
Beyond isolated processes, Chrome can request processes with more privileges: privileged processes (PP). In this case those processes will be forked from another zygote. There are several types of those zygotes, we will refer to them as Other Zygote (OZ) for simplicity. The decisions whether to start an isolated process through an AZ, and when to start a new AZ are made dynamically and depends on a few factors.
The suffixes of this histogram, as described below, correspond to distinct execution scenarios:
Suffix "Browser": the native library is loaded in the main app process
Suffix "Zygote": OZ forks into AZ, AZ loads the native library, AZ forks into IP
Suffix "Child": OZ forks into PP, PP loads the native library
Suffix "Child": OZ forks into IP, IP loads the native library
Suffix "Child": OZ forks into AZ, AZ fails to load the native library, AZ forks into IP, IP loads the native library (this scenario should happen rarely).
After library loading happens in the AZ, the recorded histogram value (for simplicity) gets copied to each child process forked from this AZ process and uploaded "as if" it is a unique sample from this child process. This leads to a discrepancy in sample counts.
In early 2021-10 it had about 7% extra uploaded samples in "ChromiumAndroidLinker.ZygoteLoadTime2".

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.{ProcessType}ThreadLoadTime
histogram.summary:
The amount of CPU time (thread time) it took to load the native libraries in {ProcessType}.
For a more detailed description of each suffix process type suffix (Browser, Child, Zygote) see description of the ChromiumAndroidLinker.*LoadTime2.

histogram.summary: The result of an install or an update check.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.UpdateCompleteResult
histogram.summary: The result of an install or an update check.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.UpdateCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Time to complete an Install or an Update component update call.

histogram.name: Conflicts.ConfirmedBadModules
histogram.summary: The number of confirmed bad modules found during module enumeration.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateLoadedModules
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the loaded modules in the browser process.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateShellExtensions
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the shell extensions.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateWinsockModules
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the Winsock LSP modules.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerationInspectionTime
histogram.summary: The cumulative length of time it takes to inspect all modules on disk, extracting their certificates and version information. This work is actually spread out over a much longer period of time so as not to impact the user.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerationTotalTime
histogram.summary: The cumulative length of time it takes to enumerate and inspect all modules. This work is actually spread out over a much longer period of time so as not to impact the user.

histogram.name: Conflicts.SuspectedBadModules
histogram.summary: The number of suspected bad modules found during module enumeration.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.ChromeOsSignalStrength
histogram.summary:
Connectivity Diagnostics App: WiFi signal strength recorded during NIC_SIGNAL_STRENGTH test.
The "Strength" property of a WiFi signal is a partially-reversible function that linearly maps the RSSI range -120dBm to -20dBm to Strength values from 0 to 100.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.RESOLVER_LATENCY
histogram.summary:
Resolution latency seen by the Connectivity Diagnostics.
Resolver latency is computed by using the chrome.dns API to query three randomly generated Google hostnames (*-ccd-testing-v4.metric.gstatic.com). The random hostnames guarantees that there will be no caching of DNS hostnames. The time taken from issuing the DNS request to receiving a response is clocked in JavaScript and the arithmetic mean of the three times is used as the resolver latency.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.CancelSystemTouches
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98 as the Context menu implementation changed.
histogram.summary: Logs true when the system touches are cancelled in order to show the Context Menu instead of performing a default system action. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.DelayedElementDetails
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98 as the context menu implementation changed.
histogram.summary: Logged when DOM element details are not yet available when the user completes a long press. Also logs if the context menu was shown once the element details became available or if the display was cancelled. This ensures that all context menu gestures are eventually processed. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.DOMElementFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98 as the ContextMenu implementation changed.
histogram.summary: Logged when the Context Menu will be displayed. Also logs if the element for the last touch was found in the main frame or a iframe. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.iOS.CopyImage
histogram.summary: Logged when the copying image from context menu is invoked and relevant events happen during the copying image procedure.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.iOS.GetImageDataByJsResult
histogram.summary: Result of getting image data by JavaScript for CopyImage, SaveImage and SearchByImage from iOS context menu. Recorded when the JavaScript returns, or fails for timeout.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.iOS.LensSupportStatus
histogram.summary: Whether or not Lens is supported, and if not, the reason why. Recorded only if the feature is enabled when the long-press context menu is shown for an image.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.iOS.LensWebUploadStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the upload of image data to Lens. Recorded only when the Lens feature is triggered via the context menu entry from an image long-press.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.iOS.LensWebUploadTime
histogram.summary: Logs the time it takes to upload image data to the Lens Web servers. Recorded only when the Lens feature is triggered via the context menu entry from an image long-press.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.LensChip.Event
histogram.summary: Logged when the Lens chip is shown and relevant events when the user interacts with the Lens chip. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.LensSupportStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the user supports the Lens intent and if not, the reason why. Recorded only if the feature is enabled when the long-press context menu is shown for an image.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SaveLinkType
histogram.summary: Type of the url when user saves the content through the save link context menu.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid
histogram.summary:
The option that the user selected from a context menu on Android. This is logged on Android only; check out ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS for iOS, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop for desktop. Note that if a menu is invoked on mixed content, only one of the submetrics receives the log; read the code to determine which one.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid.{LinkType}.NewTabOption
histogram.summary: This records the order of the context menu item 'Open in new tab' and 'Open in new tab in group' and the which item is selected. This is logged on Android only. It is logged when user long pressed on {LinkType} and selected either the 'Open in new tab' or the 'Open in new tab in group' item from the context menu.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop
histogram.summary: The option that the user selected from a context menu on desktop. This is logged on desktop only; check out ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS for iOS, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid for Android. Note that if a menu is invoked on mixed content, only one of the submetrics receives the log; read the code to determine which one.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Mobile.ContextMenu.WebImage.Actions, Mobile.ContextMenu.WebImageLink.Actions and Mobile.ContextMenu.WebLink.Actions in M98
histogram.summary:
The option that the user selected from a context menu on iOS. This is logged on iOS only; check out ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid for Android, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop for desktop. Note that if a menu is invoked on mixed content, only one of the submetrics receives the log; read the code to determine which one.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.Shown
histogram.summary: Recorded when a context menu is shown, sliced by whether a web contents was present. (It generally should be; indeed, this code path should not be followed when it is absent. For instance, invoking a context menu from the new tab page or from the sad tab page will not cause an emission to this histogram.) Note that this refers to link context menus, not the cut-copy-paste context menus that can appear during long presses on text on a web page or long presses in the omnibox. This is an Android-only metric; compare with RenderViewContextMenu.Shown and RenderViewContextMenu.Used on desktop.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.ThumbnailFetched
histogram.summary: Logged when the callback to fetch the thumbnail returns a result: Success (bitmap data received) or Failure (null bitmap). Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.TimeToSelectShare
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes to press on "Share" from the time context menu is shown. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.TimeToTakeAction.Abandoned
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the user to abandon the context menu after it's shown by pressing back or touching outside the menu. This is only logged if the menu is abandoned. See ContextMenu.TimeToTakeAction.SelectedItem for the cases where it is closed as a result of user interaction with the menu. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.TimeToTakeAction.SelectedItem
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the user to select an item. This is only logged if the menu is closed as a result of the user clicking a menu item or a DirectShare button. See ContextMenu.TimeToTakeAction.Abandoned for the cases where it is abandoned by the user. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.URLClicked
histogram.summary: Logged when the URL is clicked. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.ViewsTextServices.Emoji
histogram.summary: Number of times the emoji item in the views text services context menu is used.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.WaitingForElementDetails
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M98 as the context menu implementation changed.
histogram.summary: Logs true when the context menu gesture recognizer fully recognizes a long press, but is still waiting on the DOM element details before the context menu can be shown. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: Conversion.ReportSendOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of a conversion report. Recorded once per conversion report. For conversion report that has been retried, only the last retry will be counted.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableKeysPerSource
histogram.summary: Measures the number of aggregation keys provided in attribution source registration headers. Recorded once for each source registration header when parsed from the attributionsrc response.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.AssembleReportStatus
histogram.summary: Measures how often aggregatable reports are assembled successfully or failed and why. Recorded once for each aggregatable report processed by the aggregation service on each send attempt.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.CreateReportStatus
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.AggregatableReport.CreateReportStatus2 due to enum value change, 04/2022.
histogram.summary: Measures how often aggregatable reports are stored successfully or rejected and why. Recorded once for each trigger event processed by the attribution storage layer. `kNoHistograms` will be logged if the trigger doesn't declare aggregatable trigger data.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.CreateReportStatus2
histogram.summary: Measures how often aggregatable reports are stored successfully or rejected and why. Recorded once for each trigger event processed by the attribution storage layer. `kNotRegistered` will be logged if the source or trigger doesn't declare aggregatable data.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.DroppedKeysPercentage
histogram.summary: Measures the percentage of aggregation keys dropped per trigger. Recorded when creating the aggregatable histogram. Not recorded if no aggregation keys were declared.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.ExtraReportDelay
histogram.summary: Records the "extra" non-scheduled time it took to send a particular aggregatable attribution report. This is primarily due to a report's scheduled report time taking place while the browser is closed or there is network issue. Recorded when an aggregatable report is to be assembled.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.FilteredTriggerDataPercentage
histogram.summary: Measures the percentage of aggregatable trigger data filtered per trigger. Recorded when creating the aggregatable histogram. Not recorded if no trigger data was declared. This is effectively how many trigger side dimensions the reporter declared, but were not used for histogram generation.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.NumContributionsPerReport
histogram.summary: Measures the number of aggregatable histogram contributions per report. Recorded when creating the aggregatable histogram.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.ReportSendOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.AggregatableReport.ReportSendOutcome2 due to HTTP status check change, May 2022.
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of an aggregatable report. Recorded once per aggregatable report. For aggregatable report that has been retried, only the last retry will be counted.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.ReportSendOutcome2
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of an aggregatable report. Recorded once per aggregatable report. For aggregatable report that has been retried, only the last retry will be counted.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.SchedulerReportDelay
histogram.summary: Records the time difference from when the report was intended to be sent, and the actual report time. This is different from Conversions.AggregatableReport.ExtraReportDelay because it uses the send attempt report time, rather than initial report time assigned by the API. Accounts for any delays in Chrome scheduling the report. Recorded when an aggregatabl report is to be assembled.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.TimeFromTriggerToReportAssembly
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.AggregatableReport.TimeFromTriggerToReportAssembly2 due to histogram interpretation change, October 2022.
histogram.summary: Records the time between a trigger and its assembly. This is emitted whenever an aggregatable report is to be assembled by the aggregation service.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.TimeFromTriggerToReportAssembly2
histogram.summary: Records the time between a trigger and its assembly. This is emitted whenever an aggregatable report is to be assembled by the aggregation service.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableReport.TimeFromTriggerToReportSentSuccessfully
histogram.summary: Records the time between a trigger and its reporting. This is emitted only when an aggregatable report is sent succeessfully to the reporting endpoint, and not emitted for debug reports.

histogram.name: Conversions.AggregatableTriggerDataLength
histogram.summary: Measures the length of the list contained in the Attribution-Reporting-Register-Aggregatable-Trigger-Data header when present. Recorded once for each aggregatable trigger when parsed from the attributionsrc response.

histogram.name: Conversions.AppToWeb.AttributionEvents
histogram.obsolete: App To Web Impressions no longer supported through this mechanism.
histogram.summary:
Records events for the App To Web Impressions ContentProvider in order to track how many attributions are received/lost/reported to the native conversions code. Note that reported post-native only counts impressions that were cached pre-native, not all reported impressions.
A single impression may emit multiple different attribution events.

histogram.name: Conversions.AttributionSrcRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of the attributionsrc requests. Recorded when the request started and finished.

histogram.name: Conversions.ClearDataTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to clear conversion data. Logged any time site data is cleared in Chrome.

histogram.name: Conversions.ConversionIgnoredByFeaturePolicy
histogram.obsolete: Only tracked in obsolete Attribution Reporting API surface. Removed 04/22.
histogram.summary: Measures how often conversions are ignored due to the feature policy being disabled. Recorded when an attribution trigger redirect is received. Not recorded if the frame is deatched, the runtime feature is disabled, or the redirect is not same-origin with previous URL.

histogram.name: Conversions.CreateReportStatus
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.CreateReportStatus2 due to enum value change, 04/2022.
histogram.summary: Measures how often conversions are stored successfully or rejected and why. Recorded once for each conversion event processed by the attribution storage layer.

histogram.name: Conversions.CreateReportStatus2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.CreateReportStatus3 due to enum value change, 05/2022.
histogram.summary: Measures how often conversions are stored successfully or rejected and why. Recorded once for each conversion event processed by the attribution storage layer.

histogram.name: Conversions.CreateReportStatus3
histogram.summary: Measures how often event-level triggers are stored successfully or rejected and why. Recorded once for each conversion event processed by the attribution storage layer.

histogram.name: Conversions.DebugReport.HttpResponseOrNetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error info for sending a debug attribution report, recorded for each sent report. The HTTP response code is recorded if there is no net error code for the request, or the net error code indicates there was a response code failure.

histogram.name: Conversions.DebugReport.ReportRetrySucceed
histogram.summary: Records whether a particular debug attribution report was successful. Emitted for all debug attribution reports that retry.

histogram.name: Conversions.DebugReport.ReportStatus
histogram.summary: Records the high-level request status of a debug attribution report. Recorded for every debug attribution report sent.

histogram.name: Conversions.DeleteSentReportOperation
histogram.obsolete: The error rate is not high enough to merit monitoring. Removed on 2022-02-02.
histogram.summary: Measures how often conversions are deleted after being sent. Recorded once for each deletion started and each deletion completed. Deletion may fail if the browser was shut down before the deletion completed, or if there was an error during storage.

histogram.name: Conversions.EnqueueEventAllowed
histogram.summary: Measures how often sources and triggers are allowed to be enqueued for processing in the attribution manager. If the queue reaches a maximum size, additional sources and triggers are dropped. Events are enqueued while waiting for a previous debug-cookie check to complete.

histogram.name: Conversions.ExtraReportDelay
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.ExtraReportDelay2, which has a greater range.
histogram.summary: Records the "extra" non-scheduled time it took to send a particular conversion report. This is primarily due to a report's scheduled report time taking place while the browser is closed. Recorded when a conversion report is sent.

histogram.name: Conversions.ExtraReportDelay2
histogram.summary: Records the "extra" non-scheduled time it took to send a particular conversion report. This is primarily due to a report's scheduled report time taking place while the browser is closed. Recorded when a conversion report is sent.

histogram.name: Conversions.FiltersPerFilterData
histogram.summary: Measures filter sizes in source and trigger registrations. This includes filter data in source, top-level trigger, event-level and aggregatable trigger data. Recorded once for each filter data when parsed from the attributionsrc response.

histogram.name: Conversions.ImpressionIgnoredByFeaturePolicy
histogram.summary: Measures how often impressions are ignored due to the feature policy being disabled. Recorded when an attribution source is parsed. Not recorded if the runtime feature is disabled or no frame is present.

histogram.name: Conversions.ImpressionNavigationHasDeadInitiator
histogram.summary: Measures how often impressions are ignored because the initiator frame is dead by the time the navigation reaches the browser.

histogram.name: Conversions.ImpressionsDeletedInDataClearOperation
histogram.summary: Records the number of impressions deleted per clearing operation.

histogram.name: Conversions.NavigationDataHostStatus
histogram.summary: Records status for navigation data hosts. A single navigation data host may emit two status, one when the navigation started and the data host was registered, and one when the navigation finished or failed.

histogram.name: Conversions.RedirectInterceptedFrameDetached
histogram.obsolete: Only tracked in obsolete Attribution Reporting API surface. Removed 04/22.
histogram.summary: Measures how often conversions are not handled due to the frame being detached. Recorded when an attribution trigger redirect is received. This is recorded regardless of the Attribution Reporting API being enabled.

histogram.name: Conversions.RegisterConversionAllowed
histogram.summary: Measures how often conversions are dropped by the Attribution Reporting API being disabled. Recorded when a conversion is processed by the browser process. Records not allowed if within an OTR profile, or if the privacy sandbox is not allowed for the conversion and reporting origin.

histogram.name: Conversions.RegisteredConversionsPerPage
histogram.obsolete: Only tracked in obsolete Attribution Reporting API surface. Removed 04/22.
histogram.summary: Records the number of registered conversions (https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api) on a given top level page load. Recorded when the page navigates away or is otherwise closed. Only recorded for non-off-the-record profiles (OTR profiles have the feature disabled).

histogram.name: Conversions.RegisteredImpressionsPerPage
histogram.obsolete: Only tracked in obsolete Attribution Reporting API surface. Removed 04/22.
histogram.summary: Records the number of impressions attempted on a given top level page load. Recorded when the page navigates away or is otherwise closed. Only recorded for non-off-the-record profiles (OTR profiles have the feature disabled).

histogram.name: Conversions.RegisteredSourcesPerDataHost
histogram.summary: Measures the number of sources registered per data host. Recorded when the data host is disconnected or when the data host manager is destroyed.

histogram.name: Conversions.RegisteredTriggersPerDataHost
histogram.summary: Measures the number of triggers registered per data host. Recorded when the data host is disconnected or when the data host manager is destroyed.

histogram.name: Conversions.RegisterImpressionAllowed
histogram.summary: Measures how often impressions are dropped by the Attribution Reporting API being disabled. Recorded when an impression is processed by the browser process. Records not allowed if within an OTR profile, or if the privacy sandbox is not allowed for the impression and reporting origin.

histogram.name: Conversions.Report.HttpResponseOrNetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error info for sending a conversion report, recorded for each sent report. The HTTP response code is recorded if there is no net error code for the request, or the net error code indicates there was a response code failure.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportRetrySucceed
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.ReportRetrySucceed2 due to HTTP status check change, May 2022.
histogram.summary: Records whether a particular conversion report was successful. Emitted for all conversion reports which retry.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportRetrySucceed2
histogram.summary: Records whether a particular conversion report was successful. Emitted for all conversion reports which retry.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportsDeletedInDataClearOperation
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.EventReportsDeletedInDataClearOperation due to introduction of Conversions.AggregatableReportsDeletedInDataClearOperation, 09/2022.
histogram.summary: Records the number of conversion reports deleted per clearing operation.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportsDeletedInDataClearOperation.Aggregatable
histogram.summary: Records the number of aggregatable attribution reports deleted per clearing operation.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportsDeletedInDataClearOperation.Event
histogram.summary: Records the number of event-level attribution reports deleted per clearing operation.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportSendOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.ReportSendOutcome2 due to enum value change, 03/2022.
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of a conversion report. Recorded once per conversion report. For conversion report that has been retried, only the last retry will be counted.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportSendOutcome2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.ReportSendOutcome3 due to HTTP status check change, May 2022.
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of a conversion report. Recorded once per conversion report. For conversion report that has been retried, only the last retry will be counted.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportSendOutcome3
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of a conversion report. Recorded once per conversion report. For conversion report that has been retried, only the last retry will be counted.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportStatus
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Conversions.ReportStatus2 due to HTTP status check change, May 2022.
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of a conversion report. Recorded for every conversion report sent. For conversion report that has been retried, every retry will be counted.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportStatus2
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of a conversion report. Recorded for every conversion report sent. For conversion report that has been retried, every retry will be counted.

histogram.name: Conversions.SchedulerReportDelay
histogram.summary: Records the time difference from when the report was intended to be sent, and the actual report time. This is different from Conversions.ExtraReportDelay2 because it uses the send attempt report time, rather than initial report time assigned by the API. Accounts for any delays in Chrome scheduling the report. Recorded when an event-level report is to be sent.

histogram.name: Conversions.SourceDataHandleStatus
histogram.summary: Measures how often source data available to the data host manager are handled successfully or dropped and why. Recorded once for each source data available.

histogram.name: Conversions.SourceEligibleDataHostLifeTime
histogram.summary: Records the time between the registration and completion of a data host that is eligible to register a source. For trigger data hosts, the completion time is when the trigger data is available for the data host. For source data hosts, the completion time is after the final source data is available for the data host. This can be used as an upper bound to determine the amount of delay a trigger event may receive.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.ClearDataWithFilterDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to do perform a clear operation on the database when supplied an origin filter. Recorded when the conversion database finishes performing a clear operation. Note that filters may vary in size and computation complexity, skewing this metric aribtrarily.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.CreationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to initialize a new conversions database from scratch. Recorded when the conversion database finishes initialization. Only recorded on platforms with base::ThreadTicks support.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.MigrationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to migrate a preexisting conversions database to the latest schema. Recorded when the conversion database finishes initialization. Only recorded on platforms with base::ThreadTicks support.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.Sql.InitStatus
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in 2021-08 with Conversions.Storage.Sql.InitStatus2. Due to a bug, this metric would not properly record kFailedToInitializeSchema.
histogram.summary: Records initialisation statuses of ConversionStorageSql. Note: currently ConversionStorageSql is initialised lazily.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.Sql.InitStatus2
histogram.summary: Records initialisation statuses of ConversionStorageSql. Note: currently ConversionStorageSql is initialised lazily.

histogram.name: Conversions.TimeFromConversionToReportSend
histogram.summary: Records the time between a conversion and its reporting. This is emitted whenever a conversion report is sent.

histogram.name: Conversions.TimeFromTriggerToReportSentSuccessfully
histogram.summary: Records the time between a trigger and its reporting. This is emitted only when an event-level report is sent successfully to the reporting endpoint, and not emitted for debug reports.

histogram.name: Conversions.TriggerDataHandleStatus
histogram.summary: Measures how often trigger data available to the data host manager are handled successfully or dropped and why. Recorded once for each trigger data available.

histogram.name: Conversions.TriggerQueueDelay
histogram.summary: Records the delay between a trigger being received by the AttributionDataHostManagerImpl and it being processed. Only recorded for triggers that are added to the trigger queue, rather than handled immediately or dropped.

histogram.name: Conversions.TriggerQueueEvents
histogram.summary: Records events for triggers that may be delayed using a queue by AttributionDataHostManagerImpl. A single trigger may emit multiple events if it is part of the queue.

histogram.name: Conversions.UniqueDestinationLimitForUnexpiredSourcesResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of checking whether an attribution source is allowed by the unique destination limit covered by unexpired sources, compared with the result covered by pending sources. Recorded once for each source registration if there is capacity to store sources.

histogram.name: Conversions.UniqueReportingOriginsPerPage.Conversions
histogram.obsolete: Only tracked in obsolete Attribution Reporting API surface. Removed 04/22.
histogram.summary: Records the number of unique reporting origins for registered conversions on a given top-level page load. Recorded when the page navigates away or is otherwise closed. Only recorded for non-off-the-record profiles (OTR profiles have the feature disabled).

histogram.name: Conversions.UniqueReportingOriginsPerPage.Impressions
histogram.obsolete: Only tracked in obsolete Attribution Reporting API surface. Removed 04/22.
histogram.summary: Records the number of unique reporting origins for registered event impressions and navigation impressions attempted on a given top-level page load. Recorded when the page navigates away or is otherwise closed. Only recorded for non-off-the-record profiles (OTR profiles have the feature disabled).

histogram.name: Conversions.ValuesPerFilter
histogram.summary: Measures the number of values in a filter. This includes filter data in source, top-level trigger, event-level and aggregatable trigger data. Recorded once for each filter in the filter data when parsed from the attributionsrc response.

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.CacheHit
histogram.summary: The cache hit status of metadata extraction for AppIndexing.

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.ExtractionFailedUs
histogram.summary:
The time spent on scanning the document in the main frame to extract the metadata. The metadata would be used to feed Icing for CopylessPaste feature on Android. This only counts pages with failed or empty JSON extraction.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.ExtractionStatus
histogram.summary: The error status of metadata extraction for AppIndexing.

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.ExtractionUs
histogram.summary:
The time spent on scanning the document in the main frame to extract the metadata. The metadata would be used to feed Icing for CopylessPaste feature on Android. This only counts pages with successful JSON extraction.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CrashExitCodes.Extension
histogram.summary: The exit codes for crashed extension processes. Note: Due to https://crbug.com/805754, the enum labels are off by 1 for M56 and earlier.

histogram.name: CrashExitCodes.Renderer
histogram.summary: The exit codes for crashed renderer processes. Note: Due to https://crbug.com/805754, the enum labels are off by 1 for M56 and earlier.

histogram.name: Crashpad.AnrUpload.Skipped
histogram.summary: The reason that an ANR upload was skipped.

histogram.name: Crashpad.CrashReportPending
histogram.summary: The reason that a crash report entered the upload pending state.

histogram.name: Crashpad.CrashReportSize
histogram.summary: The size of a crash report minidump on disk when captured.

histogram.name: Crashpad.CrashUpload.AttemptSuccessful
histogram.summary: Logs whether a crash uploaded succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Crashpad.CrashUpload.Skipped
histogram.summary: The reason that a crash report upload was skipped.

histogram.name: Crashpad.ExceptionCaptureResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of execution of the Crashpad exception handler.

histogram.name: Crashpad.ExceptionCode.Mac
histogram.summary: The exception code encountered in a crash on Mac OS X.

histogram.name: Crashpad.ExceptionCode.Win
histogram.summary: The exception code encountered in a crash on Windows.

histogram.name: Crashpad.ExceptionEncountered
histogram.summary: A count of the number of exceptions handled by Crashpad with two buckets for starting and finishing.

histogram.name: Crashpad.HandlerCrash.ExceptionCode.Mac
histogram.summary: The exception code encountered for a crash of the crash handler process on Mac OS X.

histogram.name: Crashpad.HandlerCrash.ExceptionCode.Win
histogram.summary: The exception code encountered for a crash of the crash handler process on Windows.

histogram.name: Crashpad.HandlerLifetimeMilestone
histogram.summary: Handler start/crash/exit events.

histogram.name: Crashpad.IntermediateDump.Reader.InvalidKeySize
histogram.summary: Records key id when id has an invalid sizein an intermediate dump.

histogram.name: Crashpad.IntermediateDump.Reader.MissingKey
histogram.summary: Records key id when id is missing in an intermediate dump.

histogram.name: CrashReport.BreakpadIOSUploadOutcome
histogram.summary: Reports the Foundation error code of an attempt to upload a breakpad crash report. "NSNoError" if the upload was successful.

histogram.name: CrashReport.Sender.ActiveRuntime
histogram.obsolete: As of 2020-12, we've decided on a timeout and no longer need this metric.
histogram.summary: The amount of time crash_sender takes to run when invoked directly on Chrome OS, without counting time spent sleeping (e.g. for hold_off_time). Used to make an informed decision about a timeout.

histogram.name: CrashReport.Sender.Runtime
histogram.obsolete: As of 2020-12, we've decided on a timeout and no longer need this metric.
histogram.summary: The amount of time crash_sender takes to run when invoked directly on Chrome OS. Used to make an informed decision about a timeout.

histogram.name: Crypto.TPMDuration.{Operation}{SignatureAlgorithm}
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records status for various TPM operations that Chrome artificially triggers on startup for measurement purposes. Note that if new key creation fails, wrapped key creation and message signing will not take place.

histogram.name: Crypto.TPMOperation.{Operation}{SignatureAlgorithm}
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records status for various TPM actions that Chrome artificially triggers on startup for measurement purposes. Note that if new key creation fails, wrapped key creation and message signing will not take place.

histogram.name: Crypto.TPMSupport2
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records whether a TPM is present and, if so, what the best supported algorithm is.

histogram.name: DataPack.Load
histogram.summary: Errors when trying to load DataPack files.

histogram.name: DataSaver.BlockingReadOSSettingCall
histogram.summary: Time that the UI thread is blocked on loading the Android Data Saver setting from the OS.

histogram.name: DBus.AsyncMethodCallSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether an asynchronous D-Bus method call is successful.

histogram.name: DBus.AsyncMethodCallTime
histogram.summary: The time spent for an asynchronous D-Bus method call.

histogram.name: DBus.ExportedMethodHandleSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether a call to a D-Bus exported method is handled successfully.

histogram.name: DBus.ExportedMethodHandleTime
histogram.summary: The time spent for handling a call to a D-Bus exported method.

histogram.name: DBus.SignalHandleTime
histogram.summary: The time spent for handling a D-Bus signal.

histogram.name: DBus.SignalSendTime
histogram.summary: The time spent for sending a D-Bus signal.

histogram.name: DBus.SyncMethodCallSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether a synchronous D-Bus method call is successful.

histogram.name: DBus.SyncMethodCallTime
histogram.summary: The time spent for a synchronous D-Bus method call.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.ActivateSettings.ErrorHresult
histogram.summary: The HRESULT from ActivateApplication when opening the Win10+ settings page fails.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.InfoBar.UserInteraction
histogram.summary: Possible user interactions with the default browser info bar.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.InteractionResult
histogram.summary: Results of interaction with set-as-default dialog in Win8+ first run flow.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.SetDefaultResult2
histogram.summary: The outcome of an attempt to set Chrome as the user's default browser.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.SettingsInteraction.ConcludeReason
histogram.summary: The reason why the default browser settings interaction concluded on Windows 10.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.SettingsInteraction.RegistryWatcherDuration
histogram.summary: The registry keys for the default browser protocols (http/https) are monitored to know when the user finished interacting with the system settings. This is how long it took for the last registry watcher to get signaled.
